b'According to all known laws of aviation, there is no way that a bee should be able to fly. Its wings are too small to get its fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway. Because bees don\xe2\x80\x99t care what humans think is impossible.\xe2\x80\x9d SEQ. 75 - \xe2\x80\x9cINTRO TO BARRY\xe2\x80\x9d INT. BENSON HOUSE - DAY ANGLE ON: Sneakers on the ground. Camera PANS UP to reveal BARRY BENSON\xe2\x80\x99S BEDROOM ANGLE ON: Barry\xe2\x80\x99s hand flipping through different sweaters in his closet. BARRY Yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black...oohh, black and yellow... ANGLE ON: Barry wearing the sweater he picked, looking in the mirror. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Yeah, let\xe2\x80\x99s shake it up a little. He picks the black and yellow one. He then goes to the sink, takes the top off a CONTAINER OF HONEY, and puts some honey into his hair. He squirts some in his mouth and gargles. Then he takes the lid off the bottle, and rolls some on like deodorant. CUT TO: INT. BENSON HOUSE KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Barry\xe2\x80\x99s mother, JANET BENSON, yells up at Barry. JANET BENSON Barry, breakfast is ready! CUT TO: Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 1. INT. BARRY\xe2\x80\x99S ROOM - CONTINUOUS BARRY Coming! SFX: Phone RINGING. Barry\xe2\x80\x99s antennae vibrate as they RING like a phone. Barry\xe2\x80\x99s hands are wet. He looks around for a towel. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Hang on a second! He wipes his hands on his sweater, and pulls his antennae down to his ear and mouth. BARRY (CONT\'D) Hello? His best friend, ADAM FLAYMAN, is on the other end. ADAM Barry? BARRY Adam? ADAM Can you believe this is happening? BARRY Can\xe2\x80\x99t believe it. I\xe2\x80\x99ll pick you up. Barry sticks his stinger in a sharpener. SFX: BUZZING AS HIS STINGER IS SHARPENED. He tests the sharpness with his finger. SFX: Bing. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Looking sharp. ANGLE ON: Barry hovering down the hall, sliding down the staircase bannister. Barry\xe2\x80\x99s mother, JANET BENSON, is in the kitchen. JANET BENSON Barry, why don\xe2\x80\x99t you use the stairs? Your father paid good money for those. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 2. BARRY Sorry, I\xe2\x80\x99m excited. Barry\xe2\x80\x99s father, MARTIN BENSON, ENTERS. He\xe2\x80\x99s reading a NEWSPAPER with the HEADLINE, \xe2\x80\x9cQueen gives birth to thousandtuplets: Resting Comfortably.\xe2\x80\x9d MARTIN BENSON Here\xe2\x80\x99s the graduate. We\xe2\x80\x99re very proud of you, Son. And a perfect report card, all B\xe2\x80\x99s. JANET BENSON (mushing Barry\xe2\x80\x99s hair) Very proud. BARRY Ma! I\xe2\x80\x99ve got a thing going here. Barry re-adjusts his hair, starts to leave. JANET BENSON You\xe2\x80\x99ve got some lint on your fuzz. She picks it off. BARRY Ow, that\xe2\x80\x99s me! MARTIN BENSON Wave to us. We\xe2\x80\x99ll be in row 118,000. Barry zips off. BARRY Bye! JANET BENSON Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house! CUT TO: SEQ. 750 - DRIVING TO GRADUATION EXT. BEE SUBURB - MORNING A GARAGE DOOR OPENS. Barry drives out in his CAR. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 3. ANGLE ON: Barry\xe2\x80\x99s friend, ADAM FLAYMAN, standing by the curb. He\xe2\x80\x99s reading a NEWSPAPER with the HEADLINE: \xe2\x80\x9cFrisbee Hits Hive: Internet Down. Bee-stander: \xe2\x80\x9cI heard a sound, and next thing I knew...wham-o!.\xe2\x80\x9d Barry drives up, stops in front of Adam. Adam jumps in. BARRY Hey, Adam. ADAM Hey, Barry. (pointing at Barry\xe2\x80\x99s hair) Is that fuzz gel? BARRY A little. It\xe2\x80\x99s a special day. Finally graduating. ADAM I never thought I\xe2\x80\x99d make it. BARRY Yeah, three days of grade school, three days of high school. ADAM Those were so awkward. BARRY Three days of college. I\xe2\x80\x99m glad I took off one day in the middle and just hitchhiked around the hive. ADAM You did come back different. They drive by a bee who\xe2\x80\x99s jogging. ARTIE Hi Barry! BARRY (to a bee pedestrian) Hey Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. Barry and Adam drive from the suburbs into the city. ADAM Hey, did you hear about Frankie? Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 4. BARRY Yeah. ADAM You going to his funeral? BARRY No, I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to his funeral. Everybody knows you sting someone you die, you don\xe2\x80\x99t waste it on a squirrel. He was such a hot head. ADAM Yeah, I guess he could\xe2\x80\x99ve just gotten out of the way. The DRIVE through a loop de loop. BARRY AND ADAM Whoa...Whooo...wheee!! ADAM I love this incorporating the amusement park right into our regular day. BARRY I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s why they say we don\xe2\x80\x99t need vacations. CUT TO: SEQ. 95 - GRADUATION EXT. GRADUATION CEREMONY - CONTINUOUS Barry and Adam come to a stop. They exit the car, and fly over the crowd to their seats. * BARRY * (re: graduation ceremony) * Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under * the circumstances. * They land in their seats. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Well Adam, today we are men. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 5. ADAM We are. BARRY Bee-men. ADAM Amen! BARRY Hallelujah. Barry hits Adam\xe2\x80\x99s forehead. Adam goes into the rapture. An announcement comes over the PA. ANNOUNCER (V.O) Students, faculty, distinguished bees...please welcome, Dean Buzzwell. ANGLE ON: DEAN BUZZWELL steps up to the podium. The podium has a sign that reads: \xe2\x80\x9cWelcome Graduating Class of:\xe2\x80\x9d, with train-station style flipping numbers after it. BUZZWELL Welcome New Hive City graduating class of... The numbers on the podium change to 9:15. BUZZWELL (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) ...9:15. (he clears his throat) And that concludes our graduation ceremonies. And begins your career at Honex Industries. BARRY Are we going to pick our job today? ADAM I heard it\xe2\x80\x99s just orientation. The rows of chairs change in transformer-like mechanical motion to Universal Studios type tour trams. Buzzwell walks off stage. BARRY (re: trams) Whoa, heads up! Here we go. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 6. SEQ. 125 - \xe2\x80\x9cFACTORY\xe2\x80\x9d FEMALE VOICE (V.O) Keep your hands and antennas inside the tram at all times. (in Spanish) Dejen las manos y antennas adentro del tram a todos tiempos. BARRY I wonder what it\xe2\x80\x99s going to be like? ADAM A little scary. Barry shakes Adam. BARRY AND ADAM AAHHHH! The tram passes under SIGNS READING: \xe2\x80\x9cHonex: A Division of Honesco: A Part of the Hexagon Group.\xe2\x80\x9d TRUDY Welcome to Honex, a division of Honesco, and a part of the Hexagon group. BARRY This is it! The Honex doors OPEN, revealing the factory. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Wow. TRUDY We know that you, as a bee, have worked your whole life to get to the point where you can work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant pollen jocks bring the nectar to the hive where our top secret formula is automatically color-corrected, scent adjusted and bubble contoured into this... Trudy GRABS a TEST TUBE OF HONEY from a technician. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 7. TRUDY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) ...soothing, sweet syrup with its distinctive golden glow, you all know as... EVERYONE ON THE TRAM (in unison) H-o-n-e-y. Trudy flips the flask into the crowd, and laughs as they all scramble for it. ANGLE ON: A GIRL BEE catching the honey. ADAM (sotto) That girl was hot. BARRY (sotto) She\xe2\x80\x99s my cousin. ADAM She is? BARRY Yes, we\xe2\x80\x99re all cousins. ADAM Right. You\xe2\x80\x99re right. TRUDY At Honex, we also constantly strive to improve every aspect of bee existence. These bees are stress testing a new helmet technology. ANGLE ON: A STUNT BEE in a HELMET getting hit with a NEWSPAPER, then a SHOE, then a FLYSWATTER. He gets up, and gives a \xe2\x80\x9cthumb\xe2\x80\x99s up\xe2\x80\x9d. The graduate bees APPLAUD. ADAM (re: stunt bee) What do you think he makes? BARRY Not enough. TRUDY And here we have our latest advancement, the Krelman. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 8. BARRY Wow, what does that do? TRUDY Catches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it. Saves us millions. ANGLE ON: The Krelman machine. Bees with hand-shaped hats on, rotating around a wheel to catch drips of honey. Adam\xe2\x80\x99s hand shoots up. ADAM Can anyone work on the Krelman? TRUDY Of course. Most bee jobs are small ones. But bees know that every small job, if it\xe2\x80\x99s done well, means a lot. There are over 3000 different bee occupations. But choose carefully, because you\xe2\x80\x99ll stay in the job that you pick for the rest of your life. The bees CHEER. ANGLE ON: Barry\xe2\x80\x99s smile dropping slightly. BARRY The same job for the rest of your life? I didn\xe2\x80\x99t know that. ADAM What\xe2\x80\x99s the difference? TRUDY And you\xe2\x80\x99ll be happy to know that bees as a species haven\xe2\x80\x99t had one day off in 27 million years. BARRY So you\xe2\x80\x99ll just work us to death? TRUDY (laughing) We\xe2\x80\x99ll sure try. Everyone LAUGHS except Barry. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 9. The tram drops down a log-flume type steep drop. Cameras flash, as all the bees throw up their hands. The frame freezes into a snapshot. Barry looks concerned. The tram continues through 2 doors. FORM DISSOLVE TO: SEQ. 175 - \xe2\x80\x9cWALKING THE HIVE\xe2\x80\x9d INT. HONEX LOBBY ANGLE ON: The log-flume photo, as Barry looks at it. ADAM Wow. That blew my mind. BARRY (annoyed) \xe2\x80\x9cWhat\xe2\x80\x99s the difference?\xe2\x80\x9d Adam, how could you say that? One job forever? That\xe2\x80\x99s an insane choice to have to make. ADAM Well, I\xe2\x80\x99m relieved. Now we only have to make one decision in life. BARRY But Adam, how could they never have told us that? ADAM Barry, why would you question anything? We\xe2\x80\x99re bees. We\xe2\x80\x99re the most perfectly functioning society on Earth. They walk by a newspaper stand with A SANDWICH BOARD READING: \xe2\x80\x9cBee Goes Berserk: Stings Seven Then Self.\xe2\x80\x9d ANGLE ON: A BEE filling his car\xe2\x80\x99s gas tank from a honey pump. He fills his car some, then takes a swig for himself. NEWSPAPER BEE (to the bee guzzling gas) Hey! Barry and Adam begin to cross the street. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 10. BARRY Yeah but Adam, did you ever think that maybe things work a little too well around here? They stop in the middle of the street. The traffic moves perfectly around them. ADAM Like what? Give me one example. BARRY (thinks) ...I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. But you know what I\xe2\x80\x99m talking about. They walk off. SEQ. 400 - \xe2\x80\x9cMEET THE JOCKS\xe2\x80\x9d SFX: The SOUND of Pollen Jocks. PAN DOWN from the Honex statue. J-GATE ANNOUNCER Please clear the gate. Royal Nectar Force on approach. Royal Nectar Force on approach. BARRY Wait a second. Check it out. Hey, hey, those are Pollen jocks. ADAM Wow. FOUR PATROL BEES FLY in through the hive\xe2\x80\x99s giant Gothic entrance. The Patrol Bees are wearing fighter pilot helmets with black visors. ADAM (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen them this close. BARRY They know what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to go outside the hive. ADAM Yeah, but some of them don\xe2\x80\x99t come back. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 11. The nectar from the pollen jocks is removed from their backpacks, and loaded into trucks on their way to Honex. A SMALL CROWD forms around the Patrol Bees. Each one has a PIT CREW that takes their nectar. Lou Loduca hurries a pit crew along: LOU LODUCA You guys did great! You\xe2\x80\x99re monsters. You\xe2\x80\x99re sky freaks! I love it! I love it! SCHOOL GIRLS are jumping up and down and squealing nearby. BARRY I wonder where those guys have just been? ADAM I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. BARRY Their day\xe2\x80\x99s not planned. Outside the hive, flying who-knows-where, doing who-knows-what. ADAM You can\xe2\x80\x99t just decide one day to be a Pollen Jock. You have to be bred for that. BARRY Right. Pollen Jocks cross in close proximity to Barry and Adam. Some pollen falls off, onto Barry and Adam. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Look at that. That\xe2\x80\x99s more pollen than you and I will ever see in a lifetime. ADAM (playing with the pollen) It\xe2\x80\x99s just a status symbol. I think bees make too big a deal out of it. BARRY Perhaps, unless you\xe2\x80\x99re wearing it, and the ladies see you wearing it. ANGLE ON: Two girl bees. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 12. ADAM Those ladies? Aren\xe2\x80\x99t they our cousins too? BARRY Distant, distant. ANGLE ON: TWO POLLEN JOCKS. JACKSON Look at these two. SPLITZ Couple of Hive Harrys. JACKSON Let\xe2\x80\x99s have some fun with them. The pollen jocks approach. Barry and Adam continue to talk to the girls. GIRL 1 It must be so dangerous being a pollen jock. BARRY Oh yeah, one time a bear had me pinned up against a mushroom. He had one paw on my throat, and with the other he was slapping me back and forth across the face. GIRL 1 Oh my. BARRY I never thought I\xe2\x80\x99d knock him out. GIRL 2 (to Adam) And what were you doing during all of this? ADAM Obviously I was trying to alert the authorities. The girl swipes some pollen off of Adam with a finger. BARRY (re: pollen) I can autograph that if you want. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 13. JACKSON Little gusty out there today, wasn\xe2\x80\x99t it, comrades? BARRY Yeah. Gusty. BUZZ You know, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to hit a sunflower patch about six miles from here tomorrow. BARRY Six miles, huh? ADAM (whispering) Barry. BUZZ It\xe2\x80\x99s a puddle-jump for us. But maybe you\xe2\x80\x99re not up for it. BARRY Maybe I am. ADAM (whispering louder) You are not! BUZZ We\xe2\x80\x99re going, oh-nine hundred at JGate. ADAM (re: j-gate) Whoa. BUZZ (leaning in, on top of Barry) What do you think, Buzzy Boy? Are you bee enough? BARRY I might be. It all depends on what oh-nine hundred means. CUT TO: SEQ. 450 - \xe2\x80\x9cTHE BALCONY\xe2\x80\x9d Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 14. INT. BENSON HOUSE BALCONY - LATER Barry is standing on the balcony alone, looking out over the city. Martin Benson ENTERS, sneaks up behind Barry and gooses him in his ribs. MARTIN BENSON Honex! BARRY Oh, Dad. You surprised me. MARTIN BENSON (laughing) Have you decided what you\xe2\x80\x99re interested in, Son? BARRY Well, there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of choices. MARTIN BENSON But you only get one. Martin LAUGHS. BARRY Dad, do you ever get bored doing the same job every day? MARTIN BENSON Son, let me tell you something about stirring. (making the stirring motion) You grab that stick and you just move it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm, it\xe2\x80\x99s a beautiful thing. BARRY You know dad, the more I think about it, maybe the honey field just isn\xe2\x80\x99t right for me. MARTIN BENSON And you were thinking of what, making balloon animals? That\xe2\x80\x99s a bad job for a guy with a stinger. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 15. BARRY Well no... MARTIN BENSON Janet, your son\xe2\x80\x99s not sure he wants to go into honey. JANET BENSON Oh Barry, you are so funny sometimes. BARRY I\xe2\x80\x99m not trying to be funny. MARTIN BENSON You\xe2\x80\x99re not funny, you\xe2\x80\x99re going into honey. Our son, the stirrer. JANET BENSON You\xe2\x80\x99re going to be a stirrer?! BARRY No one\xe2\x80\x99s listening to me. MARTIN BENSON Wait until you see the sticks I have for you. BARRY I can say anything I want right now. I\xe2\x80\x99m going to get an ant tattoo. JANET BENSON Let\xe2\x80\x99s open some fresh honey and celebrate. BARRY Maybe I\xe2\x80\x99ll pierce my thorax! MARTIN BENSON (toasting) To honey! BARRY Shave my antennae! JANET BENSON To honey! Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 16. BARRY Shack up with a grasshopper, get a gold tooth, and start calling everybody \xe2\x80\x9cDawg.\xe2\x80\x9d CUT TO: SEQ. 760 - \xe2\x80\x9cJOB PLACEMENT\xe2\x80\x9d EXT. HONEX LOBBY - CONTINUOUS ANGLE ON: A BEE BUS STOP. One group of bees stands on the pavement, as another group hovers above them. A doubledecker bus pulls up. The hovering bees get on the top level, and the standing bees get on the bottom. Barry and Adam pull up outside of Honex. ADAM I can\xe2\x80\x99t believe we\xe2\x80\x99re starting work today. BARRY Today\xe2\x80\x99s the day. Adam jumps out of the car. ADAM (O.C) Come on. All the good jobs will be gone. BARRY Yeah, right... ADAM Any chance of getting on to the Krelman, Sir? BUZZWELL Sure, you\xe2\x80\x99re on. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 18. He plops the KRELMAN HAT onto Adam\xe2\x80\x99s head. ANGLE ON: The job board. THE COLUMNS READ: \xe2\x80\x9cOCCUPATION\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cPOSITIONS AVAILABLE\xe2\x80\x9d, and \xe2\x80\x9cSTATUS\xe2\x80\x9d. The middle column has numbers, and the right column has job openings flipping between \xe2\x80\x9copen\xe2\x80\x9d, \xe2\x80\x9cpending\xe2\x80\x9d, and \xe2\x80\x9cclosed\xe2\x80\x9d. BUZZWELL (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Oh, I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry. The Krelman just closed out. ADAM Oh! He takes the hat off Adam. BUZZWELL Wax Monkey\xe2\x80\x99s always open. The Krelman goes from \xe2\x80\x9cClosed\xe2\x80\x9d to \xe2\x80\x9cOpen\xe2\x80\x9d. BUZZWELL (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) And the Krelman just opened up again. ADAM What happened? BUZZWELL Well, whenever a bee dies, that\xe2\x80\x99s an opening. (pointing at the board) See that? He\xe2\x80\x99s dead, dead, another dead one, deady, deadified, two more dead. Dead from the neck up, dead from the neck down. But, that\xe2\x80\x99s life. ANGLE ON: Barry\xe2\x80\x99s disturbed expression. ADAM (feeling pressure to decide) Oh, this is so hard. Heating, cooling, stunt bee, pourer, stirrer, humming, inspector no. 7, lint coordinator, stripe supervisor, antenna-ball polisher, mite wrangler-- Barry, Barry, what do you think I should-- Barry? Thank you. LOU LODUCA Okay, you got a rain advisory today and as you all know, bees cannot fly in rain. So be careful. Everyone FLIPS their goggles down. Pit crew bees CRANK their wings, and remove the starting blocks. We hear loud HUMMING. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 22. LOU LODUCA (CONT\'D) LOU LODUCA (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Pound those petunia\'s, you striped stem-suckers! All of you, drain those flowers! SEQ. 800 - \xe2\x80\x9cFLYING WITH THE JOCKS\xe2\x80\x9d The bees climb above tree tops in formation. Barry is euphoric. BARRY Whoa! I\xe2\x80\x99m out! I can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99m out! So blue. Ha ha ha! (a beat) I feel so fast...and free. (re: kites in the sky) Box kite! Wow! They fly by several bicyclists, and approach a patch of flowers. BARRY (CONT\'D) Flowers! SPLITZ This is blue leader. We have roses visual. Bring it around thirty degrees and hold. BARRY (sotto) Roses. JACKSON Thirty degrees, roger, bringing it around. Many pollen jocks break off from the main group. They use their equipment to collect nectar from flowers. Barry flies down to watch the jocks collect the nectar. JOCK Stand to the side kid, it\xe2\x80\x99s got a bit of a kick. The jock fires the gun, and recoils. Barry watches the gun fill up with nectar. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 23. BARRY Oh, that is one Nectar Collector. JOCK You ever see pollination up close? BARRY No, Sir. He takes off, and the excess pollen dust falls causing the flowers to come back to life. JOCK (as he pollinates) I pick some pollen up over here, sprinkle it over here, maybe a dash over there, pinch on that one...see that? It\xe2\x80\x99s a little bit of magic, ain\xe2\x80\x99t it? The FLOWERS PERK UP as he pollinates. BARRY Wow. That\xe2\x80\x99s amazing. Why do we do that? JOCK ...that\xe2\x80\x99s pollen power, Kid. More pollen, more flowers, more nectar, more honey for us. BARRY Cool. The Jock WINKS at Barry. Barry rejoins the other jocks in the sky. They swoop in over a pond, kissing the surface. We see their image reflected in the water; they\xe2\x80\x99re really moving. They fly over a fountain. BUZZ I\xe2\x80\x99m picking up a lot of bright yellow, could be daisies. Don\xe2\x80\x99t we need those? SPLITZ Copy that visual. We see what appear to be yellow flowers on a green field. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 24. They go into a deep bank and dive. BUZZ Hold on, one of these flowers seems to be on the move. SPLITZ Say again...Are you reporting a moving flower? BUZZ Affirmative. SEQ. 900 - \xe2\x80\x9cTENNIS GAME\xe2\x80\x9d The pollen jocks land. It is a tennis court with dozens of tennis balls. A COUPLE, VANESSA and KEN, plays tennis. The bees land right in the midst of a group of balls. KEN (O.C) That was on the line! The other bees start walking around amongst the immense, yellow globes. SPLITZ This is the coolest. What is it? They stop at a BALL on a white line and look up at it. JACKSON I don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but I\xe2\x80\x99m loving this color. SPLITZ (smelling tennis ball) Smells good. Not like a flower. But I like it. JACKSON Yeah, fuzzy. BUZZ Chemical-y. JACKSON Careful, guys, it\xe2\x80\x99s a little grabby. Barry LANDS on a ball and COLLAPSES. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 25. BARRY Oh my sweet lord of bees. JACKSON Hey, candy brain, get off there! Barry attempts to pulls his legs off, but they stick. BARRY Problem! A tennis shoe and a hand ENTER FRAME. The hand picks up the ball with Barry underneath it. BARRY (CONT\'D) Guys! BUZZ This could be bad. JACKSON Affirmative. Vanessa walks back to the service line, BOUNCES the ball. Each time it BOUNCES, the other bees cringe and GASP. ANGLE ON: Barry, terrified. Pure dumb luck, he\xe2\x80\x99s not getting squished. BARRY (with each bounce) Very close...Gonna Hurt...Mamma\xe2\x80\x99s little boy. SPLITZ You are way out of position, rookie. ANGLE ON: Vanessa serving. We see Barry and the ball up against the racket as she brings it back. She tosses the ball into the air; Barry\xe2\x80\x99s eyes widen. The ball is STRUCK, and the rally is on. KEN Coming in at you like a missile! Ken HITS the ball back. Barry feels the g-forces. ANGLE ON: The Pollen Jocks watching Barry pass by them in SLOW MOTION. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 26. BARRY (in slow motion) Help me! JACKSON You know, I don\'t think these are flowers. SPLITZ Should we tell him? JACKSON I think he knows. BARRY (O.S) What is this?! Vanessa HITS a high arcing lob. Ken waits, poised for the return. We see Barry having trouble maneuvering the ball from fatigue. KEN (overly confident) Match point! ANGLE ON: Ken running up. He has a killer look in his eyes. He\xe2\x80\x99s going to hit the ultimate overhead smash. KEN (CONT\'D) You can just start packing up Honey, because I believe you\xe2\x80\x99re about to eat it! ANGLE ON: Pollen Jocks. JACKSON Ahem! Ken is distracted by the jock. KEN What? No! He misses badly. The ball rockets into oblivion. Barry is still hanging on. ANGLE ON: Ken, berating himself. KEN (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Oh, you cannot be serious. We hear the ball WHISTLING, and Barry SCREAMING. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 27. BARRY Yowser!!! SEQ. 1000 - \xe2\x80\x9cSUV\xe2\x80\x9d The ball flies through the air, and lands in the middle of the street. It bounces into the street again, and sticks in the grille of an SUV. INT. CAR ENGINE - CONTINUOUS BARRY\xe2\x80\x99S POV: the grille of the SUV sucks him up. He tumbles through a black tunnel, whirling vanes, and pistons. BARRY AHHHHHHHHHHH!! OHHHH!! EECHHH!! AHHHHHH!! Barry gets chilled by the A/C system, and sees a frozen grasshopper. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) (re: grasshopper) Eww, gross. CUT TO: INT. CAR - CONTINUOUS The car is packed with a typical suburban family: MOTHER, FATHER, eight-year old BOY, LITTLE GIRL in a car seat and a GRANDMOTHER. A big slobbery DOG is behind a grate. Barry pops into the passenger compartment, hitting the Mother\xe2\x80\x99s magazine. MOTHER There\xe2\x80\x99s a bee in the car! They all notice the bee and start SCREAMING. BARRY Aaahhhh! Barry tumbles around the car. We see the faces from his POV. MOTHER Do something! Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 28. FATHER I\xe2\x80\x99m driving! Barry flies by the little girl in her CAR SEAT. She waves hello. LITTLE GIRL Hi, bee. SON He\xe2\x80\x99s back here! He\xe2\x80\x99s going to sting me! The car SWERVES around the road. Barry flies into the back, where the slobbery dog SNAPS at him. Barry deftly avoids the jaws and gross, flying SPITTLE. MOTHER Nobody move. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t move, he won\xe2\x80\x99t sting you. Freeze! Everyone in the car freezes. Barry freezes. They stare at each other, eyes going back and forth, waiting to see who will make the first move. Barry blinks. GRANNY He blinked! Granny pulls out a can of HAIR SPRAY. SON Spray him, Granny! Granny sprays the hair spray everywhere. FATHER What are you doing? GRANNY It\xe2\x80\x99s hair spray! Extra hold! MOTHER Kill it! Barry gets sprayed back by the hair spray, then sucked out of the sunroof. CUT TO: Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 29. EXT. CITY STREET - CONTINUOUS BARRY Wow. The tension level out here is unbelievable. I\xe2\x80\x99ve got to get home. As Barry flies down the street, it starts to RAIN. He nimbly avoids the rain at first. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Whoa. Whoa! Can\xe2\x80\x99t fly in rain! Can\xe2\x80\x99t fly in rain! Can\xe2\x80\x99t fly in-- A couple of drops hit him, his wings go limp and he starts falling. BARRY (CONT\'D) Mayday! Mayday! Bee going down! Barry sees a window ledge and aims for it and just makes it. Shivering and exhausted, he crawls into an open window as it CLOSES. SEQ. 1100 - \xe2\x80\x9cVANESSA SAVES BARRY\xe2\x80\x9d INT. VANESSA\xe2\x80\x99S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Inside the window, Barry SHAKES off the rain like a dog. Vanessa, Ken, Andy, and Anna ENTER the apartment. VANESSA Ken, can you close the window please? KEN Huh? Oh. (to Andy) Hey, check out my new resume. I made it into a fold-out brochure. You see? It folds out. Ken holds up his brochure, with photos of himself, and a resume in the middle. ANGLE ON: Barry hiding behind the curtains, as Ken CLOSES THE WINDOW. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 30. BARRY Oh no, more humans. I don\xe2\x80\x99t need this. Barry HOVERS up into the air and THROWS himself into the glass. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) (dazed) Ow! What was that? He does it again, and then multiple more times. BARRY (CONT\'D) Maybe this time...this time, this time, this time, this time, this time, this time, this time. Barry JUMPS onto the drapes. BARRY (CONT\'D) (out of breath) Drapes! (then, re: glass) That is diabolical. KEN It\xe2\x80\x99s fantastic. It\xe2\x80\x99s got all my special skills, even my top ten favorite movies. ANDY What\xe2\x80\x99s your number one? Star Wars? KEN Ah, I don\xe2\x80\x99t go for that, (makes Star Wars noises), kind of stuff. ANGLE ON: Barry. BARRY No wonder we\xe2\x80\x99re not supposed to talk to them. They\xe2\x80\x99re out of their minds. KEN When I walk out of a job interview they\xe2\x80\x99re flabbergasted. They can\xe2\x80\x99t believe the things I say. Barry looks around and sees the LIGHT BULB FIXTURE in the middle of the ceiling. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 31. BARRY (re: light bulb) Oh, there\xe2\x80\x99s the sun. Maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s a way out. Barry takes off and heads straight for the light bulb. His POV: The seventy-five watt label grows as he gets closer. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) I don\xe2\x80\x99t remember the sun having a big seventy five on it. Barry HITS the bulb and is KNOCKED SILLY. He falls into a BOWL OF GUACAMOLE. Andy dips his chip in the guacamole, taking Barry with it. ANGLE ON: Ken and Andy. KEN I\xe2\x80\x99ll tell you what. You know what? I predicted global warming. I could feel it getting hotter. At first I thought it was just me. Barry\xe2\x80\x99s POV: Giant human mouth opening. KEN (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Wait! Stop! Beeeeeee! ANNA Kill it! Kill it! They all JUMP up from their chairs. Andy looks around for something to use. Ken comes in for the kill with a big TIMBERLAND BOOT on each hand. KEN Stand back. These are winter boots. Vanessa ENTERS, and stops Ken from squashing Barry. VANESSA (grabs Ken\xe2\x80\x99s arm) Wait. Don\xe2\x80\x99t kill him. CLOSE UP: on Barry\xe2\x80\x99s puzzled face. KEN You know I\xe2\x80\x99m allergic to them. This thing could kill me. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 32. VANESSA Why does his life have any less value than yours? She takes a GLASS TUMBLER and places it over Barry. KEN Why does his life have any less value than mine? Is that your statement? VANESSA I\xe2\x80\x99m just saying, all life has value. You don\xe2\x80\x99t know what he\xe2\x80\x99s capable of feeling. Barry looks up through the glass and watches this conversation, astounded. Vanessa RIPS Ken\xe2\x80\x99s resume in half and SLIDES \x8b\xec\xffu\x0c\xffu\x08\xffu\x04\xe8\xae\r\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x0cSVU\x8b\xec\x8dd$\xf8\x89E\xf8\x89U\xfc\x8dU\xf8\x80\xe1?\x8a\xc1< r\x19\x8b\xca\x83\xc1\x04\x8b\x19\x8a\xc8\x80\xe9 \xd3\xeb\x89\x1a\x83\xc2\x04j\x00\x8f\x02\xeb(\x8b\x1a\x8a\xc8\xd3\xeb\x8b\xca\x83\xc1\x04\x8b1j Y*\xc8\xd3\xe6\x0b\xde\x89\x1a\x8b\xda\x83\xc3\x04\x83\xc2\x04\x8b\x12\x8a\xc8\xd3\xea\x89\x13\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfc\xc9^[\xc3SVWU\x8b\xec\x8dd$\xf0\x89E\xf8\x89U\xfc\x8b\xf13\xc0\x89E\xf0\x8b\xc6\x83\xc6\x01\x8a\x08\x8a\xd1\x80\xf9\x00t\x07\x80\xfa%t\x14\xeb"\x8bE\xfc2\xd2\x8bM\xf8\xff\xd1\x8bE\xf0\xc9_^[\xc33\xdb3\xff2\xc0\x88E\xf42\xc0\x88E\xf5\xeb\n\x8bE\xfc\x8bM\xf8\xff\xd1\xeb\xbf\x8b\xc6\x83\xc6\x01\x8a\x00\x8a\xc8<\x00t\xb2\x80\xf9-t\x02\xeb\x08j\x01X\x88E\xf4\xeb\xe4\x80\xf9.t\x02\xeb\x08j\x01X\x88E\xf5\xeb\xd5\x80\xf90|\x0b\xeb\x10\x8aE\xf5\x84\xc0u\x10\xeb!\x80\xf9st/\xebV\x80\xf99~\xeb\xeb\xf2j\nZ\x8b\xc7\xf7\xe2\x80\xe90\x0f\xbe\xc9\x8b\xf8\x03\xf9\xeb\xa4j\nZ\x8b\xc3\xf7\xe2\x80\xe90\x0f\xbe\xc9\x8b\xd8\x03\xd9\xeb\x91\x8bE\x14\x83\xc0\x04\x89E\x14\x8bE\x14\x83\xe8\x04\x8b\x08\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfcS\x8a]\xf4S\xe8\xf0\x01\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x08\xe9\'\xff\xff\xff\x80\xf9dt\x02\xeb*\x8bE\x14\x83\xc0\x04\x89E\x14\x8bE\x14\x83\xe8\x04\x8b\x08\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfcWS\x8a]\xf4S\xe8V\x01\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x0c\xe9\xf6\xfe\xff\xff\x80\xf9ut\x02\xeb,\x8bE\x14\x83\xc0\x04\x89E\x14\x8bE\x14\x83\xe8\x04\x8b\x08\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfcWS\x8a]\xf4Sj\x00\xe8,\x02\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x10\xe9\xc3\xfe\xff\xff\x80\xf9xt\x02\xeb,\x8bE\x14\x83\xc0\x04\x89E\x14\x8bE\x14\x83\xe8\x04\x8b\x08\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfcj\x00WS\x8a]\xf4S\xe8J\x00\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x10\xe9\x90\xfe\xff\xff\x80\xf9Xt\x02\xeb,\x8bE\x14\x83\xc0\x04\x89E\x14\x8bE\x14\x83\xe8\x04\x8b\x08\x8bE\xf8\x8bU\xfcj\x01WS\x8a]\xf4S\xe8\x17\x00\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x10\xe9]\xfe\xff\xff\x8bE\xfc\x8a\xd1\x8bM\xf8\xff\xd1\xe9N\xfe\xff\xffSVWU\x8b\xec\x8dd$\xe8\x8b\xd8\x8dE\xe8\x8b\xf0\x83\xc6\x18\x83\xee\x01\xc6\x06\x00\x83}\x1c\x17v\x05j\x17\x8fE\x1c\x83\xf9\x00t\x02\xeb\x14\x83\xee\x01\xc6\x060\x8b\xfe2\xc03\xc9I\xf2\xae\xf7\xd1I\xeb<\x83\xf9\x00t\xed\x8b\xc1\x83\xe0\x0f<\n|\x02\xeb\t\x83\xee\x01\x040\x88\x06\xeb\x08\x80} \x00u\x07\xeb\x10\xc1\xe9\x04\xeb\xda\x83\xee\x01\x04A,\n\x88\x06\xeb\xf0\x83\xee\x01\x04a,\n\x88\x06\xeb\xe5;M\x1cr\x02\xeb\x0b\x83\xee\x01\xc6\x060\x83\xc1\x01\xeb\xee\x8b\xc3\x8b\xce\xffu\x18\x8a]\x14S\xe8q\x00\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x08\xc9_^[\xc3SU\x8b\xec\x83\xf9\x00|\x02\xeb\x18\xf7\xd9\xffu\x14\xffu\x10\x8a]\x0cSj-\xe8\xeb\x00\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x10\xeb\x14\xffu\x14\xffu\x10\x8a]\x0cSj\x00\xe8\xd5\x00\x00\x00\x83\xc4\x10\xc9[\xc3SVWU\x8b\xec\x8dd$\xf8\x89E\xf8\x89U\xfc\x8b\xf93\xf6;\xf7r\x02\xeb\x10\x8bE\xfcj \x17v\x05j\x17\x8fE under the glass. KEN (wistful) My brochure. There\xe2\x80\x99s a moment of eye contact as she carries Barry to the window. She opens it and sets him free. VANESSA There you go, little guy. KEN (O.C) I\xe2\x80\x99m not scared of them. But, you know, it\xe2\x80\x99s an allergic thing. ANDY (O.C) * Hey, why don\xe2\x80\x99t you put that on your * resume-brochure? * KEN (O.C) It\xe2\x80\x99s not funny, my whole face could puff up. ANDY (O.C) Make it one of your \xe2\x80\x9cSpecial Skills.\xe2\x80\x9d KEN (O.C) You know, knocking someone out is also a special skill. CUT TO: Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 33. EXT. WINDOWSILL - CONTINUOUS Barry stares over the window frame. He can\xe2\x80\x99t believe what\xe2\x80\x99s just happened. It is still RAINING. KEN Vanessa, next week? Yogurt night? VANESSA Uh, yeah sure Ken. You know, whatever. KEN You can put carob chips on there. VANESSA Good night. KEN (as he exits) Supposed to be less calories, or something. VANESSA Bye. She shuts the door. Vanessa starts cleaning up. BARRY I\xe2\x80\x99ve got to say something. She saved my life. I\xe2\x80\x99ve got to say something. Alright, here it goes. Barry flies in. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 34. INT. VANESSA\xe2\x80\x99S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Barry hides himself on different PRODUCTS placed along the kitchen shelves. He hides on a Bumblebee Tuna can, and a \xe2\x80\x9cGreetings From Coney Island\xe2\x80\x9d MUSCLE-MAN POSTCARD on the fridge. BARRY (on fridge) What would I say? (landing on a bottle) I could really get in trouble. He stands looking at Vanessa. BARRY (CONT\'D) It\xe2\x80\x99s a bee law. You\xe2\x80\x99re not supposed to talk to a human. I can\xe2\x80\x99t believe I\xe2\x80\x99m doing this. I\xe2\x80\x99ve got to. Oh, I can\xe2\x80\x99t do it! Come on! No, yes, no, do it! I can\xe2\x80\x99t. How should I start it? You like jazz? No, that\xe2\x80\x99s no good. Here she comes. Speak, you fool. As Vanessa walks by, Barry takes a DEEP BREATH. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) (cheerful) Umm...hi. Vanessa DROPS A STACK OF DISHES, and HOPS BACK. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry. VANESSA You\xe2\x80\x99re talking. BARRY Yes, I know, I know. VANESSA You\xe2\x80\x99re talking. BARRY I know, I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry. I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry. VANESSA It\xe2\x80\x99s okay. It\xe2\x80\x99s fine. It\xe2\x80\x99s just, I know I\xe2\x80\x99m dreaming, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t recall going to bed. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 35. BARRY Well, you know I\xe2\x80\x99m sure this is very disconcerting. VANESSA Well yeah. I mean this is a bit of a surprise to me. I mean...you\xe2\x80\x99re a bee. BARRY Yeah, I am a bee, and you know I\xe2\x80\x99m not supposed to be doing this, but they were all trying to kill me and if it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t for you...I mean, I had to thank you. It\xe2\x80\x99s just the way I was raised. Vanessa intentionally JABS her hand with a FORK. VANESSA Ow! BARRY That was a little weird. VANESSA (to herself) I\xe2\x80\x99m talking to a bee. BARRY Yeah. VANESSA I\xe2\x80\x99m talking to a bee. BARRY Anyway... VANESSA And a bee is talking to me... BARRY I just want you to know that I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful, and I\xe2\x80\x99m going to leave now. VANESSA Wait, wait, wait, wait, how did you learn to do that? BARRY What? Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 36. VANESSA The talking thing. BARRY Same way you did, I guess. Mama, Dada, honey, you pick it up. VANESSA That\xe2\x80\x99s very funny. BARRY Yeah. Bees are funny. If we didn\xe2\x80\x99t laugh, we\xe2\x80\x99d cry. With what we have to deal with. Vanessa LAUGHS. BARRY (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) Anyway. VANESSA Can I, uh, get you something? BARRY Like what? VANESSA I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. I mean, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. Coffee? BARRY Well, uh, I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to put you out. VANESSA It\xe2\x80\x99s no trouble. BARRY Unless you\xe2\x80\x99re making anyway. VANESSA Oh, it takes two minutes. BARRY Really? VANESSA It\xe2\x80\x99s just coffee. BARRY I hate to impose. Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 37. VANESSA Don\xe2\x80\x99t be ridiculous. BARRY Actually, I would love a cup. VANESSA Hey, you want a little rum cake? BARRY I really shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t. VANESSA Have a little rum cake. BARRY No, no, no, I can\xe2\x80\x99t. VANESSA Oh, come on. BARRY You know, I\xe2\x80\x99m trying to lose a couple micrograms here. VANESSA Where? BARRY Well... These stripes don\xe2\x80\x99t help. VANESSA You look great. BARRY I don\xe2\x80\x99t know if you know anything about fashion. Vanessa starts POURING the coffee through an imaginary cup and directly onto the floor. BARRY (CONT\'D) Are you alright? VANESSA No. DISSOLVE TO: SEQ. 1300 - \xe2\x80\x9cROOFTOP COFFEE\xe2\x80\x9d Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 38. EXT. VANESSA\xe2\x80\x99S ROOF - LATER Barry and Vanessa are drinking coffee on her roof terrace. He is perched on her keychain. BARRY ...He can\xe2\x80\x99t get a taxi. He\xe2\x80\x99s making the tie in the cab, as they\xe2\x80\x99re flying up Madison. So he finally gets there. VANESSA Uh huh? BARRY He runs up the steps into the church, the wedding is on... VANESSA Yeah? BARRY ...and he says, watermelon? I thought you said Guatemalan. VANESSA Uh huh? BARRY Why would I marry a watermelon? Barry laughs. Vanessa doesn\xe2\x80\x99t. VANESSA Oh! Is that, uh, a bee joke? BARRY Yeah, that\xe2\x80\x99s the kind of stuff that we do. VANESSA Yeah, different. A BEAT. VANESSA (CONT\xe2\x80\x99D) So anyway...what are you going to do, Barry? Bee Movie - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 39. BARRY About work? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. I want to do my part for the hive, but I can\xe2\x80\x99t do it the way they want.'
